title: Demonspawn
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

*This page refers to the player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Demonspawn (monster)](/Demonspawn_\(monster\) "Demonspawn (monster)"). For a list of all monstrous demonspawn, see [List of demonspawn](/List_of_demonspawn "List of demonspawn"). For a list of their mutations, see [Demonspawn mutations](/Demonspawn_mutations "Demonspawn mutations").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Demonspawn are horrible half-mortal, half-infernal creatures. Demonspawn can be created in any number of ways: magical experiments, breeding, unholy pacts, etc. Although many Demonspawn may initially be indistinguishable from those of pure mortal stock, they will inevitably grow horns, scales or other unusual features. Powerful members of this class of beings also develop a range of unholy abilities, which are listed as mutations.Demonspawn advance slowly in experience and learn most skills slightly slower than Humans, although they are talented at some forms of magic. They learn Invocations especially quickly, although the good gods will not accept their worship due to their unholy nature. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [8 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [9 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- Demonspawn are considered **[evil](/Evil "Evil")** - they cannot worship any of the good gods ([Zin](/Zin "Zin"), [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon"), or [The Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One")), they have vulnerability to [holy damage](/Holy "Holy") and [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath"), and the [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") brand is disabled for them. However, they aren't true [demons](/Demon "Demon"), so they don't get any of the demonic resistances by default (e.g. no poison/torment resistance without a mutation).

Demonspawn have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 8, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 8 and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 8 (before Background modifiers).

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Gladiator](/Gladiator "Gladiator")
- **Zealots:** [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker")
- **Mages:** [Hedge Wizard](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard"), [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer"), [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist"), [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist"), [Venom Mage](/Venom_Mage "Venom Mage")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 to a random [stat](/Stat "Stat") every 4th level.
- Average [HP](/HP "HP") and [MP](/MP "MP").
- +3 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.
- Gain more of your "demonic ancestry" (random [demonspawn mutations](/Demonspawn_mutations "Demonspawn mutations")) as you rise in level. The levels this occurs at are randomized, but will include at least five full-ranked mutations by level 27. Some of these mutations are available only to Demonspawn. Note that demonspawn mutations will increase the damage you take from [silver](/Silver "Silver") weaponry.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Demonspawn begin with the equipment and skills listed for their background, adjusted for their aptitudes.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species") • **[Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species")** • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Demonspawn can be a moderately difficult race to play. They are similar to [Humans](/Human "Human"), but with worse aptitudes and leveling. To compensate, you'll get random mutations over time - these vary from irritating, to interesting, to game-changing. See the [demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation") page if you want to figure out the ways your character can grow. It can take a while for these mutations to really develop, so their early game can be difficult.

Since Demonspawn can't worship [good gods](/Good_god "Good god") or wield [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") weapons, their options in [extended](/Extended "Extended") are more limited. However, by the time you reach extended, you'll have a full gamut of mutations to take advantage of.

## Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

|                [Skill](/Skill "Skill")               | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :--------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                     ***Attack***                     |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|           [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")           |                 0                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                               -1 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                               -1 |
|                                                      |                                  |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                               -1 |                                                    |                                  |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") |                -1                | [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)") |                               -1 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                                0 |
|                 [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                 |                -1                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                                0 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                                0 |
|           [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")           |                -1                |                                                 |                                  | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                                0 |
|              [Staves](/Staves "Staves")              |                -1                |    [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")    |                                3 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                                1 |
|  [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat")  |                -1                |      [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")     |                                0 | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                               -1 |
|           [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")           |                -1                | [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") |                               -2 | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                      |                                0 |
|                                                      |                                  |                                                 |                                  | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                               -1 |
|     [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")     |                -1                |                                                 |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                               -1 |
|       [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")      |                -1                |                                                 |                                  | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                               -1 |
|  [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")  |                -1                |      [Experience](/Experience "Experience")     |                               -1 | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                               -1 |

## Tips & Tricks

Some combinations of demonspawn mutations have great synergy with some character types:

- Casters with knowledge of [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud") will greatly enjoy having [Icemail](/Icemail "Icemail"); dropping a cloud around you will cancel out most fire based spells.
- [Powered by Pain](/Powered_by_Pain "Powered by Pain") / [Powered by Death](/Powered_by_Death "Powered by Death") and [Mana Shield](/Mana_Shield "Mana Shield") can give you fantastic mana regeneration and durability.

## Trivia

Demonspawn are by far the most popular species, judging from the number of online games played. Note that, due to the prevalence of [start scumming](/Scumming "Scumming") for a 'good' mutation set, this number is most likely inflated.

## History

Demonspawn are as unstable as they are in game. For changes in their mutation set, see [Demonspawn mutation's History](/Demonspawn_mutations#History "Demonspawn mutations").

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Demonspawn had 1 more intelligence, for base attributes of 8 Str / 9 Int / 8 Dex.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Demonspawn dealt more damage than normal while wielding demonic weapons ([demon tridents](/Demon_trident "Demon trident"), [demon whips](/Demon_whip "Demon whip"), and [demon blades](/Demon_blade "Demon blade")).

| [Species](/Species "Species") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Simple                        | [Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf") • [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") • [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") • [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") • [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") • [Troll](/Troll "Troll") • [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") • [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") • [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") |
| Intermediate                  | [Human](/Human "Human") • [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold") • [Demonspawn]() • [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") • [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan") • [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul") • [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu") • [Oni](/Oni "Oni") • [Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi")                                                                            |
| Advanced                      | [Coglin](/Coglin "Coglin") • [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") • [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") • [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod") • [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") • [Naga](/Naga "Naga") • [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode") • [Felid](/Felid "Felid") • [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy")                               |
html:
Demonspawn

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

This page refers to the player species. For the monster, see Demonspawn (monster). For a list of all monstrous demonspawn, see List of demonspawn. For a list of their mutations, see Demonspawn mutations.

Demonspawn are horrible half-mortal, half-infernal creatures. Demonspawn can be created in any number of ways: magical experiments, breeding, unholy pacts, etc. Although many Demonspawn may initially be indistinguishable from those of pure mortal stock, they will inevitably grow horns, scales or other unusual features. Powerful members of this class of beings also develop a range of unholy abilities, which are listed as mutations.

Demonspawn advance slowly in experience and learn most skills slightly slower than Humans, although they are talented at some forms of magic. They learn Invocations especially quickly, although the good gods will not accept their worship due to their unholy nature.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skills and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 Tips & Tricks
  • 8 Trivia
  • 9 History

Innate Abilities

  • Demonspawn are considered evil - they cannot worship any of the good gods (Zin, Elyvilon, or The Shining One), they have vulnerability to holy damage and holy wrath, and the holy wrath brand is disabled for them. However, they aren't true demons, so they don't get any of the demonic resistances by default (e.g. no poison/torment resistance without a mutation).

Demonspawn have a base Strength of 8, Intelligence of 8 and Dexterity of 8 (before Background modifiers).

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Gladiator
  • Zealots: Berserker
  • Mages: Hedge Wizard, Necromancer, Fire Elementalist, Ice Elementalist, Venom Mage

Level Bonuses

  • +1 to a random stat every 4th level.
  • Average HP and MP.
  • +3 willpower per level.
  • Gain more of your "demonic ancestry" (random demonspawn mutations) as you rise in level. The levels this occurs at are randomized, but will include at least five full-ranked mutations by level 27. Some of these mutations are available only to Demonspawn. Note that demonspawn mutations will increase the damage you take from silver weaponry.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Demonspawn begin with the equipment and skills listed for their background, adjusted for their aptitudes.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Demonspawn can be a moderately difficult race to play. They are similar to Humans, but with worse aptitudes and leveling. To compensate, you'll get random mutations over time - these vary from irritating, to interesting, to game-changing. See the demonspawn mutation page if you want to figure out the ways your character can grow. It can take a while for these mutations to really develop, so their early game can be difficult.

Since Demonspawn can't worship good gods or wield holy wrath weapons, their options in extended are more limited. However, by the time you reach extended, you'll have a full gamut of mutations to take advantage of.

Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 0 Armour -1 Spellcasting -1
Dodging -1
Maces & Flails -1 Shields -1 Conjurations 0
Axes -1 Stealth 0 Hexes 0
Polearms -1 Summonings 0
Staves -1 Invocations 3 Necromancy 1
Unarmed Combat -1 Evocations 0 Translocations -1
Throwing -1 Shapeshifting -2 Alchemy 0
Fire Magic -1
Short Blades -1 Ice Magic -1
Long Blades -1 Air Magic -1
Ranged Weapons -1 Experience -1 Earth Magic -1

Tips & Tricks

Some combinations of demonspawn mutations have great synergy with some character types:

  • Casters with knowledge of Freezing Cloud will greatly enjoy having Icemail; dropping a cloud around you will cancel out most fire based spells.
  • Powered by Pain / Powered by Death and Mana Shield can give you fantastic mana regeneration and durability.

Trivia

Demonspawn are by far the most popular species, judging from the number of online games played. Note that, due to the prevalence of start scumming for a 'good' mutation set, this number is most likely inflated.

History

Demonspawn are as unstable as they are in game. For changes in their mutation set, see Demonspawn mutation's History.

  • Prior to 0.31, Demonspawn had 1 more intelligence, for base attributes of 8 Str / 9 Int / 8 Dex.
  • Prior to 0.14, Demonspawn dealt more damage than normal while wielding demonic weapons (demon tridents, demon whips, and demon blades).
Species
Simple Mountain Dwarf • Minotaur • Merfolk • Gargoyle • Draconian • Troll • Deep Elf • Armataur • Gnoll
Intermediate Human • Kobold • Demonspawn • Djinni • Spriggan • Ghoul • Tengu • Oni • Barachi
Advanced Coglin • Vine Stalker • Vampire • Demigod • Formicid • Naga • Octopode • Felid • Mummy

{{version032}}
''This page refers to the player [[species]]. For the monster, see [[Demonspawn (monster)]]. For a list of all monstrous demonspawn, see [[List of demonspawn]]. For a list of their mutations, see [[Demonspawn mutations]].''
{{flavour|Demonspawn are horrible half-mortal, half-infernal creatures. Demonspawn can be created in any number of ways: magical experiments, breeding, unholy pacts, etc. Although many Demonspawn may initially be indistinguishable from those of pure mortal stock, they will inevitably grow horns, scales or other unusual features. Powerful members of this class of beings also develop a range of unholy abilities, which are listed as mutations.

Demonspawn advance slowly in experience and learn most skills slightly slower than Humans, although they are talented at some forms of magic. They learn Invocations especially quickly, although the good gods will not accept their worship due to their unholy nature.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*Demonspawn are considered '''[[evil]]''' - they cannot worship any of the good gods ([[Zin]], [[Elyvilon]], or [[The Shining One]]), they have vulnerability to [[holy|holy damage]] and [[holy wrath]], and the [[holy wrath]] brand is disabled for them. However, they aren't true [[demon]]s, so they don't get any of the demonic resistances by default (e.g. no poison/torment resistance without a mutation).

Demonspawn have a base [[Strength]] of 8, [[Intelligence]] of 8 and [[Dexterity]] of 8 (before Background modifiers).

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Warriors:''' [[Gladiator]]
*'''Zealots:''' [[Berserker]]
*'''Mages:''' [[Hedge Wizard]], [[Necromancer]], [[Fire Elementalist]], [[Ice Elementalist]], [[Venom Mage]]

==Level Bonuses==
*+1 to a random [[stat]] every 4th level.
*Average [[HP]] and [[MP]].
*+3 [[willpower]] per level.
*Gain more of your "demonic ancestry" (random [[demonspawn mutations]]) as you rise in level. The levels this occurs at are randomized, but will include at least five full-ranked mutations by level 27. Some of these mutations are available only to Demonspawn. Note that demonspawn mutations will increase the damage you take from [[silver]] weaponry.

==Starting Skills and Equipment==
Demonspawn begin with the equipment and skills listed for their background, adjusted for their aptitudes.

==Difficulty of Play==
{{Moderate}}

Demonspawn can be a moderately difficult race to play. They are similar to [[Human]]s, but with worse aptitudes and leveling. To compensate, you'll get random mutations over time - these vary from irritating, to interesting, to game-changing. See the [[demonspawn mutation]] page if you want to figure out the ways your character can grow. It can take a while for these mutations to really develop, so their early game can be difficult.

Since Demonspawn can't worship [[good god]]s or wield [[holy wrath]] weapons, their options in [[extended]] are more limited. However, by the time you reach extended, you'll have a full gamut of mutations to take advantage of.

{{species_aptitudes|Demonspawn}}

==Tips & Tricks==
Some combinations of demonspawn mutations have great synergy with some character types:
*Casters with knowledge of [[Freezing Cloud]] will greatly enjoy having [[Icemail]]; dropping a cloud around you will cancel out most fire based spells.
*[[Powered by Pain]] / [[Powered by Death]] and [[Mana Shield]] can give you fantastic mana regeneration and durability.

==Trivia==
Demonspawn are by far the most popular species, judging from the number of online games played. Note that, due to the prevalence of [[scumming|start scumming]] for a 'good' mutation set, this number is most likely inflated.

==History==
Demonspawn are as unstable as they are in game. For changes in their mutation set, see [[Demonspawn mutations#History|Demonspawn mutation's History]].

*Prior to [[0.31]], Demonspawn had 1 more intelligence, for base attributes of 8 Str / 9 Int / 8 Dex.
*Prior to [[0.14]], Demonspawn dealt more damage than normal while wielding demonic weapons ([[demon trident]]s, [[demon whip]]s, and [[demon blade]]s).

{{species}}
